TEXT.TITLE: SOUTH CHINA STORMS KILL TWO, DAMAGE CROPS
TEXT.BODY: Hailstorms and strong winds in south China killed two people, injured 20 and damaged an undisclosed amount of crops, a Hong Kong newspaper reported. The pro-Peking New Evening Post said in a report from Canton that more than 50 houses collapsed when the storms swept across five counties in south-western Guangdong province. It said the crops were damaged over a five-day period ended yesterday. It gave no other details. REUTER
